definition: to hold back one's troops without moving (idiom); to bide one's time
to press/to push/to leave aside or shelve/to control/to restrain/to keep one's hand on/to check or refer to/according to/in the light of/(of an editor or author) to make a comment
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Just hesitate a little, still bide one's time.
sentences.chinese: 林文猶豫了一下，仍然按兵不動。

sentences.english: We shall wait the enemy out, and watch them starve.
sentences.chinese: 我們將按兵不動，等着敵人斷糧捱餓。

sentences.english: The dogs began to yip and howl, but tonight they kept their places.
sentences.chinese: 狗也擺好陣勢，要狂吠了，但是今晚，他們按兵不動。

definition: to turn a blind eye to
hawk faction (opposite: 鸽派, doves)/fierce and combative party/war party/warmongers
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to get out of trouble/to escape from danger/a danger appears/threatened by danger
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
